snippet: At Camp Rav Tov D’Satmar in the Catskills, 3,000 boys study the Torah or Talmud, exercise is hedged by rigorous Hasidic traditions and the athletic facilities are neglected.
abstract: Camp Rav Tov D’Satmar in the Catskills is one of nation's largest sleep-away boys' camps, where 3,000 Hasidic boys study the Torah or Talmud; exercise at camp is hedged by rigorous Hasidic traditions and the athletic facilities are neglected; even leisure-time activities tend toward the Talmudic (Series: Summer In...).
lead_paragraph: At Camp Rav Tov D’Satmar in the Catskills, 3,000 boys study the Torah or Talmud, exercise is hedged by rigorous Hasidic traditions and the athletic facilities are neglected.

headline.main: At a Camp for Hasidic Boys, Studying Faith Is Their Daily Exercise
headline.print_headline: At a Camp for Hasidic Boys, Studying Faith Is Their Daily Exercise
